security_audit.summary: This skill is a Markdown guidance document with no executable code. No network access, file access, or command execution is present. Risk is minimal for users.

content.user_title: Design PostgreSQL tables with best practices
content.value_statement: You need PostgreSQL tables that stay correct and fast as data grows. This skill gives clear rules for types, constraints, indexes, and partitions.
actual_capabilities: Recommend PostgreSQL data types for columns and identifiers
Advise on primary keys, identity usage, and UUID tradeoffs
Guide index selection for queries, foreign keys, and joins
Explain constraints, NULL handling, and CHECK patterns
Outline partitioning choices, limits, and tradeoffs
Provide JSONB and full text search indexing guidance
limitations: Does not execute SQL or connect to databases
Does not benchmark or profile query performance
Does not generate migrations or DDL files
Requires you to describe workloads and query patterns

use_cases.title: Design new service schema
use_cases.description: Create normalized tables with correct types, constraints, and indexes for an application backend.

use_cases.title: Plan large reporting tables
use_cases.description: Choose indexing and partitioning approaches for analytics workloads and time series data.

use_cases.title: Review MVP database design
use_cases.description: Validate early schema decisions and avoid common PostgreSQL mistakes before launch.

prompt_templates.title: Starter table design
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a PostgreSQL users table for a web app. Include columns, data types, primary key, and required indexes.

prompt_templates.title: Orders and items
prompt_templates.prompt: Design orders and order_items tables. Include keys, foreign keys, constraints, and index recommendations.

prompt_templates.title: Event logging at scale
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a time series events table for hundreds of millions of rows. Include partitioning and index strategy.

prompt_templates.title: JSONB profile data
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a user_profiles table using JSONB for optional attributes. Include constraints and GIN index guidance.

output_examples.input: Design a PostgreSQL orders schema for a SaaS product with billing status and timestamps.
output: Orders table with BIGINT identity primary key
Status column as TEXT with CHECK constraint
Foreign key to customers with explicit index

best_practices: State your query patterns and update frequency
Ask for index advice tied to real filters and joins
Review NULL handling and defaults early
anti_patterns: Using VARCHAR or CHAR without a clear need
Skipping indexes on foreign key columns

faq.question: Is it compatible with PostgreSQL 12 and newer?
faq.answer: Yes. It targets modern PostgreSQL behavior and calls out version specific items when needed.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It does not inspect your database, run benchmarks, or validate production performance.

faq.question: Can I integrate it with Claude or Codex?
faq.answer: Yes. Use the prompts in Claude, Codex, or Claude Code for schema guidance.

faq.question: Does it access my data or files?
faq.answer: No. It only provides guidance based on the text you provide.

faq.question: What if recommendations do not fit my workload?
faq.answer: Provide query patterns, volumes, and constraints to receive more tailored guidance.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic SQL advice?
faq.answer: It is focused on PostgreSQL types, indexing, constraints, and platform specific behavior.
